dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, another summit. Just what the world needed, right? More presidents talking about "peaceful resolution."

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Speaking at the Central Asia European Union summit in Samarkand, Kazakhstani President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev expressed support for the negotiation process on Ukraine... "Kazakhstan has consistently advocated for the peaceful resolution of conflicts...

dialogue_turns.text: Did he? 'Cause, like, every politician ever says they support peace. It's, um, it's pretty boilerplate, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.text: No, but, um, the important part is he thanked the European partners for supporting this UN Regional Center for Sustainable Development Goals. In Almaty!

dialogue_turns.text: Okay. A UN center. For, like, "Agenda 2030." Sounds like, you know, more bureaucracy, honestly.

dialogue_turns.text: But it's about, uh, promoting "unity in diversity," and tackling social, economic, environmental issues in the region. That's, uh, that's real stuff.

dialogue_turns.text: 'Unity in diversity.' Yeah, he said that back in February too, about Ukraine. Look, I just, I don't see how this is, like, breaking news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he's explicitly calling the dialogue between the "major powers" a positive trend. And saying it benefits Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he's explicitly calling the dialogue between the major powers a positive trend. And saying it benefits Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.text: Mmm. So, he's, uh, trying to position Kazakhstan as, like, a beneficiary of this entire mess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm. So, he's, uh, trying to position Kazakhstan as, like, a beneficiary of this entire mess?

dialogue_turns.text: He's saying they'll "support this trend as much as possible." I mean, for a Central Asian leader, that's, uh, that's pretty direct.

dialogue_turns.text: It means, uh, closer ties with the EU, maybe? More investment in that UN center? It's not nothing, dude.
